metadata.Title: CVE-2022-34526 on Ubuntu 20.04 ESM (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
A stack overflow was discovered in the _TIFFVGetField function of Tiffsplitv4.4.0. This vulnerability allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service(DoS) via a crafted TIFF file parsed by the "tiffsplit" or "tiffcrop"utilities.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-34526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiff-tools - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiff5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
libtiffxx5 - 4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: tiff package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.1.0+git191117-2ubuntu0.20.04.6').
